page.text: Kathy Truong, BA, RRT
1968 W. Woodworth Road, Anaheim, CA 92804 | kathyxtruong@gmail.com | (714) 728-1418
CA License No.: 37019
Registered Respiratory Therapist seeking a clinical position wherein I can build and solidify my skills as a
respiratory care practitioner. As a member of the healthcare provider team, I will strive to deliver optimal
care and improve patient outcomes in a compassionate, diligent, and professional manner.
Associate of Science, Respiratory Therapy; May 2015
Concorde Career College, Garden Grove campus
Valedictorian, 4.00 GPA
Bachelor of Arts, Psychology & Social Behavior; December 2008
University of California, Irvine

text.i: Basic Life Support (BLS) for Healthcare Providers
Basic computer skills including Microsoft Office

page.text: July 2014 – April 2015
Clinical sites: Chapman Medical Center, Orange Coast Memorial Medical Center, Rancho Los
Amigos National Rehabilitation Center, Tri-City Regional Medical Center
Experienced firsthand the comprehensive duties of a respiratory therapist in multiple settings
including acute, sub-acute, emergency, critical, and rehabilitative care
Assisted the physician in the OR during several diagnostic Endobronchial Ultrasound (EBUS)
procedures at Orange Coast Memorial
Adhered to hospital protocol while carrying out respiratory services such as breathing treatments,
ventilator set-up & management, bronchial hygiene, tracheostomy care, and ABG sampling

text.i: Clinical Research Coordinator, SC Clinical Research, Inc.

page.text: September 2011 – May 2013
Coordinated clinical drug trial for qualifying patients with Chronic Kidney Disease
Conducted weekly patient visits, processed laboratory samples, recorded progress notes per
protocol, and monitored the efficacy of the study drug
Performed patient intake, answered phone calls, managed patient database, created source
documents for various clinical drug studies, helped with the completion of study procedures

text.i: Development Coordinator, Vietnamese American Cancer Foundation

page.text: October 2008 – October 2009
Conducted the day-to-day operational management and implementation of activities pertaining to
the organization’s development
Drafted, edited, and prepared grants/project proposals for submission to potential funders
Attended meetings on behalf of the organization and helped out at community events

text.i: Public Health Intern, Vietnamese American Cancer Foundation

page.text: Summer 2008
Participated in public health program and fund development efforts
Produced a case management training curriculum and manual for staff to use
Wrote articles for the VACF newsletter mailed to the community
Honor Roll Certificate for Academic Excellence
Perfect Attendance Certificate
Best Clinical Application Poster – Respiratory Care Week Poster Presentation Contest 2014
